Description: Fragment of limestone ostracon: the text on both recto and verso, eighteen and sixteen lines respectively, contains a record of goods purchased by a lady Webkhet. The recto top written within red lines, perhaps never executed at bottom
Curator's comments: Bibliography: S. Birch, 'Inscriptions in the Hieratic and Demotic Character, from the Collections of the British Museum' (London, 1868), pl. XVI; J. J. Černy and A.H. Gardiner, ‘Hieratic Ostraca’ (Oxford 1957), p. 23 and pl. LXXXVI, 1; J.J. Janssen, 'Commodity Prices from the Ramessid Period' (Leiden, 1975), p. 79; K. Kitchen, 'Ramesside Inscriptions' V (Oxford, 1983), 588-9.
Bibliographic references: Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (136353) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/136353)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Somerset Lowry-Corry, 2nd Earl of Belmore
